page.title: 13CHURCHES AND CHAPELS
page.content: St.Roberts Roman Catholic Church was built in 1877 and is a shrine to local and national English martyrs.Relics of a martyred 16th century priest are on display in a side altar.20 stained glass windows and much solid oak rails and panelling beautify the church for its approximately 100 worshippers. The present Methodist Chapel was built in 1929 and is in Chapel Lane away from all the houses.The previous building known as Ranters included a stable as people came by horse.It is served by a circuit ministry. There is no Church of England in Catforth, the area being divided between the parishes of Woodplumpton and Inskip, the latter being St. Peter's Church. There is also a parish church at Treales. A Baptist chapel is also to be found in Inskip.
